alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 10:01PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Monroe County through 1045 PM EDT... At 1001 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Arrowhead Lake, or 9 miles west of Mount Pocono, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, Tobyhanna, Henryville, Pocono Pines, Skytop, Mountainhome, Canadensis, Alpine Mountain, Blakeslee, Paradise Valley, Gouldsboro State Park, Arrowhead Lake and Cresco. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 287 and 294. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
